page.title: 02FARMING AROUND CRANAGE
page.content: Cheshire is a very flat county and our area is no exception. It is very fertile and makes good farmland. Most of the farm areas are fenced and used for grazing Friesian dairy cattle and some sheep. The main arable produce is barley and vegetables, such as potatoes, carrots and cabbage. If you travel down the local roads and lanes you will see these for sale at most of the farms and smallholdings, along with free-range eggs. Opposite our school is a farm which used to have dairy cattle and vegetables. Now the land has been turned over to grazing, for another farmer's dairy herd, and for greenhouses. Here are grown bedding plants, lettuce, tomatoes and cutting-flowers. These are taken for sale at the local markets at Chelford and Crewe or sold to passers-by.
